column4: hey there I need to download the ubuntu5.10 kernel source to this winxp box, where can I find a web page with a link i can click on to download the kernel source
why do you need kernel source?
why don't you just install from a CD or something?
what're you going to do with the kernel source?
can you explain more fully what you're hoping to accomplish, here? so we can try and understand what your problem really is?
wtf are you going to do with the kernel source on a winxp box, without gcc, without gnu c libs, without anything you need to compile it?
you can download whatever debs you want from packages.ubuntu.com and put 'em on a CD
just search for the package you need via the normal search mechanism and download it from its package page
um. no it's not.
i mean the packages.ubuntu.com search page
what kernel are you running?
the kernel that comes with the edubuntu386 iso.  as a reminder im looking for which krenel pacakage to download.
type uname -r in the shell and let usknow what it says
um. can you run it?
wait... i thought you said the box had no network card?
what's the card? i'd be surprised if it wasn't supported
ah. so okay, i get it now. you want to enable your onboard nforce network card in ubuntu, and you need to build the driver for it. cool. thanks for making that clear so long ago
I thought when I entered that line 4 times it may have been clear
so now that you're clear on my problem and objective perhaps you have some info to make that happen
if you don't know what kernel you're running, this is going to be really difficult to tell you waht to download
but the standard breezy kernel is here: http://packages.ubuntu.com/breezy/devel/linux-source-2.6.12
and that ought to be all you need, yes
assuming you're using nvidia's tarball from their website
